yaml.title: Schedule
yaml.summary: POLI 328 schedule with readings, due dates, and links to materials.

markdown.markdown: ```{r packages-data, include=FALSE} library(tidyverse) library(knitr) library(kableExtra) library(lubridate) library(glue) schedule <- read_csv("data/schedule.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) ``` Here you can find the schedule for the semester with links to the list of readings for each week. In addition you'll find links to instructions for the assignments in this course. As a reminder, you are expected to submit a weekly summary for 9 weeks in the semester by 10:50 am on the corresponding Thursday. Here's a guide to the schedule: - [**Materials**](/content/) ({{< fa book-open-reader >}}): This page contains the readings and other information (if any) for the entire week. - [**Assignment**](/assignment/) ({{< fa pen-ruler >}}): This page contains the instructions for each assignment. All readings will be made available on Canvas. ```{r build-table, echo=FALSE, results="asis"} schedule <- schedule %>% mutate(var_title = ifelse(!is.na(content), glue('{title}'), glue('{title}'))) %>% mutate(var_deadline = ifelse(!is.na(deadline), glue('  (submit by {deadline})'), glue(""))) %>% mutate(var_content = ifelse(!is.na(content), glue(''), glue(''))) %>% mutate(var_assignment = ifelse(!is.na(assignment), glue(''), glue(''))) %>% mutate(col_date = ifelse(is.na(date_end), glue('{format(as.Date(date, "%m/%d/%y"), "%B %e")}'), glue('{format(as.Date(date, "%m/%d/%y"), "%B %e")}–{format(as.Date(date_end, "%m/%d/%y"), "%B %e")}'))) %>% mutate(col_title = glue('{var_title}{var_deadline}')) %>% mutate(col_content = var_content, col_assignment = var_assignment) %>% select(Week = week, Date = col_date, Title = col_title, Materials = col_content, Assignment = col_assignment) week_count <- schedule |> count(Week) week_index <- week_count |> pull(n) |> set_names(paste0("Week ", week_count$Week)) tbl <- schedule |> select(-Week) |> kbl(escap = FALSE, align = "rlccc", table.attr = 'class="schedule-table"') |> kable_styling() |> column_spec(1, width = "30%", extra_css = "padding-right: 20px;") |> column_spec(2, width = "50%") |> column_spec(c(3:4), width = "10%") |> pack_rows(index = week_index, label_row_css = "border-bottom: 2px solid #000000;") cat(tbl) ```
